work.name: Ali Mani Group, Stanford University
highlights: Direct numerical simulations of particle-laden and multiphase turbulent flow
Implementation and validation of multiphase modelling for superhydrophobic surfaces and dynamic air-water interfaces
Evaluated pressure-driven wall-normal jets for drag reduction in channel flow and boundary layer flow
Developed macroscopic forcing method for superhydrophobic surfaces and studied nonlocality in slip length operator

work.name: Tim Colonius Group, California Institute of Technology
highlights: Direct numerical simulation of flow over spinning disks
Analyzed effects of tip speed ratio and angle of attack on aerodynamic forces
SeeME is the official Stanford Mechanical Engineering outreach club

Created and taught workshops for Stanford graduate students that covered how to plan interesting and accessible classes for middle- and high-school students in the surrounding community, using evidence-based and inclusive learning and teaching practices
Mentored two PhD students for two years
Organized for members to hold lab tours and informal coffee chats with members of Stanford's undergraduate chapter of SWE
